header_summary:
Ava Chow announces the availability of Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc2 binaries, marking a significant step toward the release of a new major version, with the binaries and source code accessible for testing and review [here](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.0/test.rc2) and [here](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.0rc2). This version enters the release candidate stage, indicating a phase of extensive testing and final adjustments before the official release, with preliminary release notes available for public review [here](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/28.0-Release-Notes-Draft).

Andyschroder introduces 'Lightning Cheques,' a novel paper-based payment system for the cryptocurrency sphere, designed for offline transactions via the Lightning Network, combining a BOLT12 `invoice_request` and an `offer` on a printed format for easy, internet-independent transactions. This model aims to mimic cash transactions while introducing a trust-based system for change issuance, with potential enhancements like NFC technology for future improvements, detailed [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/lightning-cheques/1162).

Virtu presents a novel method for encoding various network addresses within DNS AAAA records, offering a new way to integrate onion (Tor), I2P, and CJDNS addresses into DNS queries with about 50% encoding efficiency. This approach, which uses the ff00::/8 IPv6 prefix for custom encoding, maintains compatibility with standard DNS resolution tools and does not interfere with server-side caching mechanisms, showcasing a blend of innovation with practicality for DNS-based applications to incorporate alternative network addresses, as discussed [here](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/hardcoded-seeds-dns-seeds-and-darknet-nodes/1123/11).

recent_posts.title: OP_KEEPCHANGE - mitigating dust outputs
recent_posts.summary:
- James Ferguson introduces "Keep the Change" to enhance Bitcoin by addressing dust.
- "OP_KEEPCHANGE" credits small UTXOs to recipients, reducing blockchain bloat and fees.
- The mechanism aims for network efficiency, improved privacy, and a stable money supply.

recent_posts.title: Shielded CSV: Private and Efficient Client-Side Validation
recent_posts.summary:
- Data storage on the blockchain faces a critical bottleneck due to a 64-byte limit.
- To mitigate double spending, a nullifier system proposes each transaction's coins be "nullified."- Privacy is enhanced by using range proofs to obscure coin creation time, balancing cryptographic properties.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.0 Release Candidate 2 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version v28.0rc2 binaries are now available for download.
- This version is a release candidate, indicating a major update is nearing completion.
- Assuming no major issues, v28.0rc2 will officially become version 28.0.

recent_posts.title: A Lightning Network of multi-party mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- The text analyzes blockchain's complexities, focusing on on-chain bandwidth and unilateral exit costs.
- HTLCs in public routing can force-close multi-party mechanisms, highlighting their fragility.
- A method to gauge N-party mechanism fragility through node uptime and connection success is introduced.

recent_posts.title: Lightning Cheques
recent_posts.summary:
- Lightning Cheques offer a paper-based cryptocurrency payment method for offline use.
- They utilize QR codes for transaction details, enhancing efficiency and reducing risks.
- Proposals aim to improve security, versatility, and include features for broader applications.

recent_posts.title: Hardcoded seeds, DNS seeds and Darknet nodes
recent_posts.summary:
- A new method encodes various network addresses in DNS records, using AAAA records.
- This technique employs the ff00::/8 prefix, allowing standard DNS tools compatibility.
- It enables seamless integration of alternative network addresses into DNS applications.

active_posts.title: Adding New BIP Editors
active_posts.summary:
- Luke's inability to manage BIPs highlights the need for more editors.
- New editors should agree on BIP numbering and have a proven track record in Bitcoin.
- Kanzure and RubenSomsen are suggested as capable candidates for BIP editors.

active_posts.title: Proposing a P2QRH BIP towards a quantum resistant soft fork
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal suggests adding quantum resistance to Bitcoin via a new signature algorithm.
- It addresses the quantum computing threat and emphasizes proactive measures for Bitcoin's security.
- Open for community feedback, it marks a step toward Bitcoin's defense against quantum vulnerabilities.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 1 vulnerability affecting Bitcoin Core <24.0.1
active_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin Core team disclosed a vulnerability, details at bitcoincore.org.
- A new disclosure policy for security vulnerabilities is now in effect.
- Further updates on vulnerabilities in versions before 25.0 are expected next month.

active_posts.title: PPLNS with job declaration
active_posts.summary:
- The SV2 extension development aims at improving mining pool payout transparency and fairness.
- It grants miners the power to select their transactions, influencing their income from varied fee structures.
- The project, in its developmental stage, invites reviews and contributions for enhancement.

active_posts.title: Who will run the CoinJoin coordinators?
active_posts.summary:
- Recent closures of Samourai and Wasabi wallets signal a shift in Bitcoin privacy tools.
- BTCPay Server's CoinJoin plugin introduces self-hosted coordination, enhancing transaction privacy.
- The author has launched their own BTCPay coordinator to counter low user adoption of new privacy services.

active_posts.title: Proving UTXO set inclusion in zero-knowledge
active_posts.summary:
- The `utxozkp` tool enhances LN channel privacy by allowing zero knowledge proof of UTXO set inclusion.
- It aims to prevent DOS attacks and future updates will reveal more details like UTXO size.
- Performance tests show a 6-minute proof generation time and a 1.4 MB proof size on an Apple M1 Max.

today_in_history_posts.title: Is it possible for there to be two chains after a hard fork?
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Gavin Andresen discusses the old Bitcoin version's viability amid a hard fork.
- A minority fork supported by 5% of miners may lead to exploitable trade scenarios.
- Long confirmation times and backlog may deter usage of the minority fork.

today_in_history_posts.title: Onion routing strawman proposal
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell shared onion routing code on GitHub, set at 3840 bytes.
- The code uses AES128, HMAC SHA256, and Bitcoin EC with ECDH for encryption.
- Rusty requested a crypto review of his code.

today_in_history_posts.title: Draft BIP for OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a TxFieldSelector for precise data selection in Bitcoin transactions.
- New opcodes, OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY, aim to enhance transaction verification.
- It seeks community feedback for potential formalization and implementation in Bitcoin Core.
